quest.name: Return to Eulmore
journal: By the way his face lights up at your approach, the manager of suites has been waiting for you.
Greeting you with his customary cheer, the master of suites informs you that the Crystal Exarch has requested your presence in the Ocular.

Having taken your place amongst your comrades in the Ocular, you discuss the mission to find and vanquish the Lightwarden of Kholusia. Yet even as you allow yourselves a moment to consider the prospect of victory, Emet-Selch sours the mood with the declaration that driving back the Light will not serve to save the world. Elaborating upon his earlier history lesson, he informs you that as Zodiark and Hydaelyn warred, the latter struck a devastating blow which sundered not only Her foe, but all of creation, into fourteen fragments. It was then, looking upon the shattered remains of their home, that the Ascians resolved to rejoin the worlds. While Emet-Selch's tale only serves to underscore the difference between your goals, you have little choice but to focus on the mission at hand. According to intelligence, the forces of Eulmore are entrenching themselves inside the city, suggesting that the Lightwarden likely hides therein. So it is that you and your comrades depart for Kholusia, having agreed to rendezvous in the village of Wright.
Joining Alphinaud and Ryne in Wright, you learn that the others have gone on ahead to reconnoiter. When the time comes for your group to follow, Alphinaud bids you clear the path of prying eyes.

On the way to Gatetown, you encounter civilians behaving strangely, as if in a trance, with some proving hostile. While their behavior is unsettling, for now the way is secure, and you press on to the settlement as planned.
You arrive in Gatetown to find it gripped by a strange phenomenon. It seems the villagers you encountered en route were far from the only ones affected...
objectives: Speak with people en route to Gatetown.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname. I trust you had a pleasant rest.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: While you were ensconced in your chamber, a message arrived for you from the Exarch. He bids you come to the Ocular at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: ...And, madamsir? Wherever your duties may take you next, I shall pray for your safe return. May the night keep you.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Your condition is unchanged? Good. If you can but hold out until the end of the coming battle, I am confident that we will find a remedy for your affliction.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: We've not spoken for a while, have we? Not since the aftermath of the eaters' attack.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Rest assured I am fully recovered, and will do my utmost to support you and your fellow Warriors of Darkness.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Yes? Did my lesson provoke thought, giving rise to further questions?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Three of you escaped the sundering. But what of those who didn't...?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I think we've talked enough.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Why, their very beings were divided into fourteen, of course. Yet by our power, we unsundered Ascians may raise up one of their fragments to their original office.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Ah, but I suppose this in itself bears explaining. So...the names by which you know us are not, in fact, our names.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Be it Elidibus or Lahabrea or Igeyorhm, all are titles of office. And when an office is vacated, it may be filled by another.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Over the eons, I have overseen several changings of the guard among our sundered brethren.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: And in such instances, the vacant title ordinarily goes to another fragment of the selfsame soul.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: While it is by no means impossible to raise up wholly unrelated individuals, 'tis we whose fervent entreaties brought forth Lord Zodiark─whose souls He claimed in the beginning─who make the truest servants.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: So, if we were to defeat all the Ascians of the Source...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: What is your true name, then?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Then none would remain to raise up new Ascians, and our kind would eventually fade from existence. You would like that, wouldn't you? Well, feel free to dream─'tis no crime to do so.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Hm! There may come a day when I reveal my true name to you─but this is not it. Of course, you may well die none the wiser, but life is full of such disappointments.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: If that is all, then run along. You have a Lightwarden to slay.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This aura... What could it be?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename. The others have gone ahead to reconnoiter Gatetown. We are to follow shortly.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It has been a while, has it not? Since the two of us infiltrated Eulmore.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Since we faced Lord Vauthry, and I felt such fury as I have never felt before.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: His actions are unconscionable, of course, and any abhorrence I felt for him entirely justified. Yet mingled with my rage, there was...something else. At first I was unsure what it was, but in the course of our struggles, I found the answer.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In Vauthry's self-righteousness─in his absolute belief that he, and he alone, is the cure to the world's ills─I saw a reflection of myself. And it brought the memories of all my past follies flooding back.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: He is the vainglorious, ignorant fool I once was. And having shared in his affliction, I feel duty-bound to open his eyes to the truth.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whether he will accept it with the good grace I did is another question...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What is it, Ryne? Do you sense the Lightwarden?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I-I'm not sure. The aura is...different.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Perhaps if we were a little closer...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis time we were on our way in any case. Let us join our comrades in Gatetown.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, as a precaution, may I ask that you go first, to ensure that the path is clear?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The closer we are to Eulmore, the more I worry that Ryne may be recognized. If you see any prying eyes along the way, pray encourage their owners to look elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Go on, Forename. We will follow anon.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: As I am now, I don't think people will recognize me as the Oracle, but Thancred did always warn against taking unnecessary risks.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSA03630
dialogue.text: Unnngh... Vauth...nnngh...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You hail the civilian, but he does not respond and continues his incoherent rambling.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSA03630
dialogue.text: Unnngh... Vauth...nnngh...

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSB03630
dialogue.text: Lord Vauthry... We hear...we obey... Aaahhh!

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSC03630
dialogue.text: Long live...Lord Vauthry... Long live...Lord Vauthry...

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSC03630
dialogue.text: Long live...live...live...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Our mission hath begun on a strange note...

dialogue.name: RESIDENT03630
dialogue.text: Wh-What's happening!? What's wrong with everyone!?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah. Good of you to join us. I was debating whether to warn you, but it's too late now.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I take it you noticed the people behaving strangely along the path? It's more of the same here.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Y'shtola and Alisaie are investigating as we speak. Let's wait and see what they have to say.
